sentence.text: Cushing's disease results from corticotroph adenomas of the pituitary that hypersecrete adrenocorticotropin (negative regulation of tumor necrosis factor production), leading to excess glucocorticoid and hypercortisolism.

entity.text: negative regulation of tumor necrosis factor production

sentence.text: However, the major driver mutations in protein K63-linked deubiquitination wild-type tumors remain elusive.
Moreover, primary corticotroph tumor cells harboring protein phosphorylation V600E are sensitive to the BRAF inhibitor vemurafenib.
